speaker: Monoco
line: It is a beautiful evening. The colours in the sky. The shining of the stars. Tonight is a night full of promise.

speaker: Verso
line: Is it?

speaker: Monoco
line: We shall bring Noco back.

speaker: Verso
line: I thought you wanted to wait, until things calmed down?

speaker: Monoco
line: Who knows how much time tomorrow will allow. No. Let us give Noco the gift of today. It’s a simple journey to the Sacred River. We’re not far, it’s close to the Station.

speaker: Verso
line: Golga won’t be happy that you’re jumping the queue again.

speaker: Monoco
line: I’ll deal with Golga later. You helped me bring Noco back once before, will you help us again, my friend?

speaker: Verso
line: Always.

speaker: Verso
line: Haven’t been here in a while.

speaker: Monoco
line: The Sacred River. Let’s make haste, I don’t want her to…

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) MONOCO! You’re trying to skip the queue again, you old… uh… old… lazy… retired warrior!

speaker: Monoco
line: How did you even know I was here?

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) You’re carrying dozens of feet around. I can smell them from the other side of the continent.

speaker: Monoco
line: Fair point.

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) We’ve been over this before. See all these Gestrals? They’re waiting in the queue like everyone else!

speaker: Monoco
line: It’s a stupid rule, we should just bring them all back now.

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) You know that would be CHAOS. There aren’t enough adult Gestrals to shepherd all the newborns. Plus I hate all the noise. Can you imagine a forest full of baby Gestrals?

speaker: Monoco
line: You leave me no choice then.

speaker: Verso
line: Oh no… Think twice, Monoco.

speaker: Monoco
line: I have already thought about it thrice. Golgra! I demand a trial by combat.

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) Humpf, I was hoping you’d say that.

speaker: Verso
line: Do I have to participate?

speaker: Monoco
line: Please, help me.

speaker: Verso
line: For Noco then.

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) May you both survive this.

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) Ah, it’s almost time for my squat session, it’s leg day. Sorry, I can’t finish this fight.

speaker: Monoco
line: Oh, come on! You’re just afraid of losing.

speaker: Verso
line: Monoco, please, shut up.

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) You did entertain me, so… I’ll let it slide this time, Monoco. Go ahead, bring him back.

speaker: Monoco
line: I won’t say thank you. Thank you.

speaker: Noco
line: (gibberish) Mo- Monoco?

speaker: Monoco
line: Ah. It’s good to hear your voice.

speaker: Verso
line: Hey, Noco. How’s my favourite merchant?

speaker: Noco
line: (gibberish) … Golgra?

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) …

speaker: Monoco
line: Golgra? Are you crying?

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) I’m not.

speaker: Noco
line: (gibberish) Can we go home?

speaker: Monoco
line: Not yet, I’m afraid. We have a mission. Do you remember our Expeditioner friends?

speaker: Noco
line: (gibberish) No?

speaker: Monoco
line: They’ll be happy to see you. They were very worried. Come, let’s go back to camp. We found many treasures for you to trade!

speaker: Noco
line: (gibberish) ……….

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) Let me take Noco to the Village. It’s always disorientating for the newly returned. Noco needs time to adjust. Noco, would you like to go back to the village?

speaker: Noco
line: (gibberish) …

speaker: Monoco
line: But I’m Noco’s guardian!

speaker: Verso
line: I know you want to keep Noco by your side. But it’s safer there. You’ll see Noco when we get back to the Village.

speaker: Noco
line: (gibberish) …

speaker: Monoco
line: Wait for me. I’ll be back as soon as I can.

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) Off we go then.

speaker: Verso
line: He’ll be fine. Better than with you, that’s for sure.

speaker: Monoco
line: That he will be. Thanks for helping. I never understood how Golgra got so freakishly strong.

speaker: Verso
line: I could take Golgra by myself.

speaker: Monoco
line: I will never show you weakness ever again.

speaker: Verso
line: Come on, let’s get back to camp.

speaker: Verso
line: You ok?

speaker: Verso
line: At least, Noco is safe, and can begin readjusting.

speaker: Monoco
line: Every time he returns, he is slightly changed. I mourn the loss of who he was before. But he’s still there, my old mentor. Thank you, my friend.

speaker: Verso
line: Noco always said that he didn’t mind waiting in the queue. Why were you so adamant about bringing him back sooner?

speaker: Monoco
line: There was never supposed to be a queue. Verso—Verso wanted us to experience the excitement of new beginnings. He gave us the gift of the river. Why shouldn’t we use it?

speaker: Monoco
line: Noco found me after the Fracture. Noco raised me, taught me, protected me. It’s my turn to protect him, that’s how it works. He took care of me, now I take care of him. Except I can’t.

speaker: Verso
line: Because of me.

speaker: Monoco
line: I know why you’re doing this. And I know how it might end. I’m not gambling on tomorrow.

speaker: Verso
line: Monoco—

speaker: Monoco
line: (tired exhale)

speaker: Verso
line: Why help me then? If—

speaker: Monoco
line: For Verso. And for you.

speaker: Verso
line: My friend.

speaker: Monoco
line: Verso gave us many new beginnings. He would have wanted a new beginning for you too. You deserve a new beginning, if you want one. Every one of us does.

speaker: Monoco
line: Now come over here and let’s snuggle.

speaker: Verso
line: Little spoon?

speaker: Monoco
line: Obviously.
